H0.text: Linear eukaryotic chromosomes differ from prokaryotic chromosomes, which are circular.

H1.text: Multiple eukaryotic chromosomes are unlike prokaryotic chromosomes.

H2.text: Eukaryotic chromosomes are simple, unlike prokaryotic chromosomes.

H3.text: Expanding is what eukaryotic chromosomes are, unlike prokaryotic chromosomes.

A4.text: Eukaryotes have linear chromosomes, while prokaryotes have circular chromosomes.

A5.text: Eukaryotes initiate DNA replication at multiple origins within chromosomes, unlike prokaryotes with a single origin on their circular chromosomes.
